sec.p: To further examine the trend of suitable area changes, we also calculated and compared the centroids of future and current suitable areas by using a python-based GIS toolkit, SDMtoolbox [ 24]. The SDMtoolbox calculates the distributional changes between two binary SDMs (e.g. current and future SDMs) [ 24], and this analysis is focused on summarizing the core distributional shifts of the ranges of P. orientalis. This analyses reduces species' distribution to a single central point (known as a centroid) and creates a vector file depicting magnitude and direction of predicted change through time. We examined the distributional shifts by tracking the changes in centroid changes among different SDMs.
